data.headline: Nasdaq fell around 1.5–1.6%, S&P 500 dropped 0.9–1.0%, Dow lost 0.8%, and Russell 2000 slid 1.6–1.8% amid broad selling pressure.
bullets: Big Tech, software, semiconductors, and AI-exposed stocks like Apple, Amazon, Meta, Nvidia, Intel, Netflix, Palantir, Shopify, Micron, and AppLovin led declines.
Office and commercial real estate stocks including CBRE, JLL, Cushman & Wakefield, and Newmark were hit hard by AI disruption concerns.
Cisco plunged over 11% after disappointing earnings.
Fastly surged more than 80%, but its rally was overshadowed by the broader tech selloff.
Weak existing home sales data added pressure to housing-related stocks.
Volatility spiked as traders rotated into value and cyclical sectors and awaited key CPI data and earnings for further direction.
